One day, Tim took his toy to the park. He wanted to show it to his friends. But when he got there, his friends said the toy was bad. They did not want to play with Tim and his toy. Tim felt sad and didn't know why his friends didn't like his toy.
Tim sat on a bench, feeling very sad. Suddenly, a big wind came and took his toy away. It flew high in the sky and Tim couldn't get it back. He was so sad that he cried. He went home without his toy, and the day had a bad ending.

"I know a place where the water is warmer and more fun. Follow me!" The seal was excited and followed the big fish. But the big fish led the seal to a place with big rocks and strong waves. The seal got scared and tried to swim away, but the waves were too strong. The seal was stuck.
The big fish laughed and said, "Now you cannot play and be happy!" The seal was very sad. The big fish had destroyed the seal's fun day. And the day ended bad for the seal.

The friends had an idea. They all went to the cave and brought warm things for the hippo. They put the warm things on the hippo, and he stopped shivering. The hippo was happy, and they all played together in the cave.

Daddy was helping Daisy to push her bike. Daisy hopped on and tried to use her feet to pedal it. But Daisy wasn’t strong enough and couldn’t even move the pedals.
“I can’t do it, Daddy!” Daisy cried, disappointed.
“Don’t be sad, Daisy! If you keep trying, I know you can do it. I’ll give you a secret.” Daddy said. “For every sour thing you eat, you’ll get more strength to pedal the bike!”

saw. It was lying in the grass, all by itself. Tom thought it was a toy and he wanted to play with it.
But the saw was selfish. It didn't want to share. It said, "Go away little bird! I don't want you to play with me!"
Tom was sad. He had never met a selfish saw before. So he sang a goodbye song and flew away.
Tom never saw the saw again. But he never forgot the lesson the saw had taught him: sometimes things don't want to share.

But as Binky waited, something unexpected happened. A big, colorful bird flew down from the sky and landed next to Binky. The bird said, "Hi, I am Birdy. I can help Bear wake up faster with my magic song." Birdy sang a beautiful song, and Bear woke up right away! Binky, Bear, and Birdy all played together and became the best of friends.

Just then, her parents burst in and saw the weapon in her hands. The princess was so scared that she started to cry. But her parents weren't mad. Instead, they hugged the princess and reminded her that it is important to always follow the rules. They also said that the princess could still study her weapon outside, so long as she did it carefully.
The princess was so relieved and happy, she hugged her parents and never made the same mistake again. And every day, she continued to study her weapon in a safe place, learning more and more about it.

alarm! He was curious and went closer to take a look but it made the noise louder. He got scared and started hopping away.
